definition: to cooperate/to harmonize/to help/to assist/to join
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Ye Lang finally wait until the old company calls, the acquisition agreement is received.
sentences.chinese: 叶朗终于等到旧公司的来电，收购协议书亦收到。

sentences.english: Most try to sign a divorce settlementby themselves first.
sentences.chinese: 大多数夫妻会先行签定离婚协议书。

sentences.english: Both of the parties must follow the terms of this agreement after signing these copies.
sentences.chinese: 这协议书必须经业主及租客双方同意而订立。

sentences.english: The settlement prohibits Colting from using his original name for the book.
sentences.chinese: 然而协议书严禁柯亭把自己的真实名字印在这本书上。

sentences.english: They sealed their cooperation by an agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们以协议书的方式保证其合作的成功。

sentences.english: 6 participate in commercial technical negotiation, participate in drafting technical agreement.
sentences.chinese: 参加商务技术谈判，参与起草项目技术协议书。

sentences.english: Pushkar lawyers come to admire, and leads to the divorce agreement.
sentences.chinese: 普什卡的律师来找佩雅，带来了离婚协议书。

sentences.english: Soviet and American leaders sign the Hot Line Agreement.
sentences.chinese: 苏美两国领导人签订了“热线协议书”。

sentences.english: They have signed a separation agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们连分局协议书都签好了。

sentences.english: Chenlong mailed both the test results and the three-side agreement to the corporation at once.
sentences.chinese: 陈龙随即将体检结果及三方协议书邮寄给公司。

sentences.english: This agreement is done in duplicate.

definition: to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
